TITLE.P: DL2021 — Data management and computing infrastucture

SHORT_DESCR.P: During 2018-2021, the Finnish Ministry of Education and Culture, together with other research and innovation operators, will implement a development programme for research infrastructures and services in data management and computing. The programme will update computing environments supporting research and improve services for research and education. To this goal, CSC — IT Center for Science Ltd is carrying out a procurement with the goal to renew CSC's high performance computing and storage infrastructure. The Finnish Meteorological Institute (FMI) is participating in the procurement. FMI is represented by CSC under a joint procurement contract.

MAIN_SITE.P: Data centers in Kajaani and in Helsinki region.

SHORT_DESCR.P: In this procurement a scientific computing infrastructure will be installed in 3 initial deliveries and possible optional deliveries, in datacenters in Kajaani or in the Helsinki region. The procured infrastructure is described in detail in the preliminary call for tender document. It comprises up to 7 systems:

AeroC: An air-cooled compute system, with a codename “AeroC”. This is the capacity (best price / performance) system, and it includes a heterogeneous set of nodes for different workloads. The workload will be a mixture of serial runs, small to mid-sized parallel runs and large embarrassingly parallel runs. This system should be designed to support the workloads similar to the benchmarks described in the attached benchmark package.

AeroS: An air-cooled efficient HPC scratch storage tightly integrated with AeroC, codenamed "AeroS''. This parallel filesystem provides compute-node accessibility via native posix compliant client, and good support for MPI-IO. AeroB: An IOPS intensive storage solution tightly integrated with AeroC. The purpose of AeroB is to handle high IOPS workloads and reduce the IO pressure on AeroS.

Lake: A common storage area, codenamed “Lake”. This is an object store that will serve as the common storage area for the new and existing HPC systems, the cPouta IaaS cloud, and the Rahti OpenShift container cloud. The capacity of this storage will be increased over the lifetime of the infrastructure.

HydroC: A high-end liquid-cooled capability system codenamed “HydroC”. This system will focus on scalability to run large jobs, using a large fraction of the total system resources. The interconnect network should provide high bisection bandwidth and low latency across the fabric. This system should be designed to support workloads similar to the benchmarks in the attached benchmark package.

HydroS: An efficient air-cooled HPC scratch storage tightly integrated with HydroC, codenamed “HydroS”. This parallel file system provides compute-node accessibility via native posix compliant client, and good support for MPI-IO and HDF5. The solution should be from the same product family as AeroS, but may be of a newer generation.

HydroB: An IOPS intensive storage solution tightly integrated with HydroC. The purpose of HydroB is to handle high IOPS workloads and reduce the IO pressure on HydroS. In all of these systems options are specified. Over the lifetime of the infrastructure the capacity of the systems is expected to be increased, based on the needs of the users. The competitiveness and relevance of the options is hence of importance. The procurement includes requirements and options for support, software and collaboration opportunities to build a integrated infrastructure from these components. RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The Customer reserves the right to an option period of 3 year(s). The Customer must declare its use of the option 6 months before the end of the agreement period.

Over the lifetime of the infrastructure the capacity of the systems is expected to be increased, based on the needs of the users. The procurement includes also requirements and options for support, software and collaboration opportunities to build an integrated infrastructure from these components.
